intro: Leonohebe pauciramosa, commonly known as the slender leonohebe, is a low-growing shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or alpine environments. It has a compact growth habit with multiple stems arising from the base, and its flowering period occurs during the late spring to early summer. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
